newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU clears bids for 190,000 T wheat at zero refund.
newsitem.headline: EU clears bids for 190,000 T wheat at zero refund.

text.p: The European Union has cleared bids to export 190,000 tonnes of soft wheat under licences carrying a daily refund of zero Ecus per tonne, France's grain office ONIC said on Thursday.

The bids were placed on Monday through France before the EU decided to scrap the zero refund on daily wheat exports, replacing it with a nil value refund that cannot be prefixed. The decision was taken in the face of volatile world prices.

On Tuesday grain exporters bid through France to export 217,000 tonnes of soft wheat under licences carrying a nil value refund and 214,500 tonnes of wheat flour under licences carrying a five Ecus per tonne refund.
The flour bids were placed before the EU replaced the five Ecus refund on flour with a nil value refund,
The EU was expected to rule on these bids later today following a meeting of its weekly grain committee.
ONIC also specified that on Wednesday grain firms bidding in France placed bids for an additional 70,000 tonnes of soft wheat grain under licences carrying a nil value refund.
The EU has three days to decide whether to clear or reject these bids.
